AbortDocumentVersionUpload.name: AbortDocumentVersionUpload
AbortDocumentVersionUpload.documentation: Aborts the upload of the specified document version that was previously initiated by InitiateDocumentVersionUpload. The client should make this call only when it no longer intends to upload the document version, or fails to do so.

ActivateUser.name: ActivateUser
ActivateUser.documentation: Activates the specified user. Only active users can access Amazon WorkDocs.

AddResourcePermissions.name: AddResourcePermissions
AddResourcePermissions.documentation: Creates a set of permissions for the specified folder or document. The resource permissions are overwritten if the principals already have different permissions.

CreateComment.name: CreateComment
CreateComment.documentation: Adds a new comment to the specified document version.

CreateCustomMetadata.name: CreateCustomMetadata
CreateCustomMetadata.documentation: Adds one or more custom properties to the specified resource (a folder, document, or version).

CreateFolder.name: CreateFolder
CreateFolder.documentation: Creates a folder with the specified name and parent folder.

CreateLabels.name: CreateLabels
CreateLabels.documentation: Adds the specified list of labels to the given resource (a document or folder)

CreateNotificationSubscription.name: CreateNotificationSubscription
CreateNotificationSubscription.documentation:
Configure Amazon WorkDocs to use Amazon SNS notifications. The endpoint receives a confirmation message, and must confirm the subscription.

For more information, see Setting up notifications for an IAM user or role in the Amazon WorkDocs Developer Guide.

CreateUser.name: CreateUser
CreateUser.documentation: Creates a user in a Simple AD or Microsoft AD directory. The status of a newly created user is "ACTIVE". New users can access Amazon WorkDocs.

DeactivateUser.name: DeactivateUser
DeactivateUser.documentation: Deactivates the specified user, which revokes the user's access to Amazon WorkDocs.

DeleteComment.name: DeleteComment
DeleteComment.documentation: Deletes the specified comment from the document version.

DeleteCustomMetadata.name: DeleteCustomMetadata
DeleteCustomMetadata.documentation: Deletes custom metadata from the specified resource.

DeleteDocument.name: DeleteDocument
DeleteDocument.documentation: Permanently deletes the specified document and its associated metadata.

DeleteDocumentVersion.name: DeleteDocumentVersion
DeleteDocumentVersion.documentation: Deletes a specific version of a document.

DeleteFolder.name: DeleteFolder
DeleteFolder.documentation: Permanently deletes the specified folder and its contents.

DeleteFolderContents.name: DeleteFolderContents
DeleteFolderContents.documentation: Deletes the contents of the specified folder.

DeleteLabels.name: DeleteLabels
DeleteLabels.documentation: Deletes the specified list of labels from a resource.

DeleteNotificationSubscription.name: DeleteNotificationSubscription
DeleteNotificationSubscription.documentation: Deletes the specified subscription from the specified organization.

DeleteUser.name: DeleteUser
DeleteUser.documentation:
Deletes the specified user from a Simple AD or Microsoft AD directory.

Deleting a user immediately and permanently deletes all content in that user's folder structure. Site retention policies do NOT apply to this type of deletion.

DescribeActivities.name: DescribeActivities
DescribeActivities.documentation: Describes the user activities in a specified time period.

DescribeComments.name: DescribeComments
DescribeComments.documentation: List all the comments for the specified document version.

DescribeDocumentVersions.name: DescribeDocumentVersions
DescribeDocumentVersions.documentation:
Retrieves the document versions for the specified document.

By default, only active versions are returned.

DescribeFolderContents.name: DescribeFolderContents
DescribeFolderContents.documentation:
Describes the contents of the specified folder, including its documents and subfolders.

By default, Amazon WorkDocs returns the first 100 active document and folder metadata items. If there are more results, the response includes a marker that you can use to request the next set of results. You can also request initialized documents.

DescribeGroups.name: DescribeGroups
DescribeGroups.documentation: Describes the groups specified by the query. Groups are defined by the underlying Active Directory.

DescribeResourcePermissions.name: DescribeResourcePermissions
DescribeResourcePermissions.documentation: Describes the permissions of a specified resource.

DescribeRootFolders.name: DescribeRootFolders
DescribeRootFolders.documentation:
Describes the current user's special folders; the RootFolder and the RecycleBin. RootFolder is the root of user's files and folders and RecycleBin is the root of recycled items. This is not a valid action for SigV4 (administrative API) clients.

This action requires an authentication token. To get an authentication token, register an application with Amazon WorkDocs. For more information, see Authentication and Access Control for User Applications in the Amazon WorkDocs Developer Guide.

DescribeUsers.name: DescribeUsers
DescribeUsers.documentation:
Describes the specified users. You can describe all users or filter the results (for example, by status or organization).

By default, Amazon WorkDocs returns the first 24 active or pending users. If there are more results, the response includes a marker that you can use to request the next set of results.

GetCurrentUser.name: GetCurrentUser
GetCurrentUser.documentation:
Retrieves details of the current user for whom the authentication token was generated. This is not a valid action for SigV4 (administrative API) clients.

This action requires an authentication token. To get an authentication token, register an application with Amazon WorkDocs. For more information, see Authentication and Access Control for User Applications in the Amazon WorkDocs Developer Guide.

GetDocumentPath.name: GetDocumentPath
GetDocumentPath.documentation:
Retrieves the path information (the hierarchy from the root folder) for the requested document.

By default, Amazon WorkDocs returns a maximum of 100 levels upwards from the requested document and only includes the IDs of the parent folders in the path. You can limit the maximum number of levels. You can also request the names of the parent folders.

GetDocumentVersion.name: GetDocumentVersion
GetDocumentVersion.documentation: Retrieves version metadata for the specified document.

GetFolder.name: GetFolder
GetFolder.documentation: Retrieves the metadata of the specified folder.

GetFolderPath.name: GetFolderPath
GetFolderPath.documentation:
Retrieves the path information (the hierarchy from the root folder) for the specified folder.

By default, Amazon WorkDocs returns a maximum of 100 levels upwards from the requested folder and only includes the IDs of the parent folders in the path. You can limit the maximum number of levels. You can also request the parent folder names.

GetResources.name: GetResources
GetResources.documentation: Retrieves a collection of resources, including folders and documents. The only CollectionType supported is SHARED_WITH_ME.

InitiateDocumentVersionUpload.name: InitiateDocumentVersionUpload
InitiateDocumentVersionUpload.documentation:
Creates a new document object and version object.

The client specifies the parent folder ID and name of the document to upload. The ID is optionally specified when creating a new version of an existing document. This is the first step to upload a document. Next, upload the document to the URL returned from the call, and then call UpdateDocumentVersion.

To cancel the document upload, call AbortDocumentVersionUpload.

RemoveAllResourcePermissions.name: RemoveAllResourcePermissions
RemoveAllResourcePermissions.documentation: Removes all the permissions from the specified resource.

RemoveResourcePermission.name: RemoveResourcePermission
RemoveResourcePermission.documentation: Removes the permission for the specified principal from the specified resource.

RestoreDocumentVersions.name: RestoreDocumentVersions
RestoreDocumentVersions.documentation: Recovers a deleted version of an Amazon WorkDocs document.

SearchResources.name: SearchResources
SearchResources.documentation: Searches metadata and the content of folders, documents, document versions, and comments.

UpdateDocument.name: UpdateDocument
UpdateDocument.documentation: Updates the specified attributes of a document. The user must have access to both the document and its parent folder, if applicable.

UpdateDocumentVersion.name: UpdateDocumentVersion
UpdateDocumentVersion.documentation:
Changes the status of the document version to ACTIVE.

Amazon WorkDocs also sets its document container to ACTIVE. This is the last step in a document upload, after the client uploads the document to an S3-presigned URL returned by InitiateDocumentVersionUpload.

UpdateFolder.name: UpdateFolder
UpdateFolder.documentation: Updates the specified attributes of the specified folder. The user must have access to both the folder and its parent folder, if applicable.

UpdateUser.name: UpdateUser
UpdateUser.documentation: Updates the specified attributes of the specified user, and grants or revokes administrative privileges to the Amazon WorkDocs site.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.
Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

TimeStamp.documentation: The timestamp when the action was performed.

IsIndirectActivity.documentation: Indicates whether an activity is indirect or direct. An indirect activity results from a direct activity performed on a parent resource. For example, sharing a parent folder (the direct activity) shares all of the subfolders and documents within the parent folder (the indirect activity).

Participants.documentation: The list of users or groups impacted by this action. This is an optional field and is filled for the following sharing activities: DOCUMENT_SHARED, DOCUMENT_SHARED, DOCUMENT_UNSHARED, FOLDER_SHARED, FOLDER_UNSHARED.

ResourceMetadata.documentation: The metadata of the resource involved in the user action.

OriginalParent.documentation: The original parent of the resource. This is an optional field and is filled for move activities.

CommentMetadata.documentation: Metadata of the commenting activity. This is an optional field and is filled for commenting activities.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Principals.documentation: The users, groups, or organization being granted permission.

ThreadId.documentation: The ID of the root comment in the thread.

Contributor.documentation: The details of the user who made the comment.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time that the comment was created.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of the comment. Options are either PRIVATE, where the comment is visible only to the comment author and document owner and co-owners, or PUBLIC, where the comment is visible to document owners, co-owners, and contributors.

RecipientId.documentation: If the comment is a reply to another user's comment, this field contains the user ID of the user being replied to.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp that the comment was created.

RecipientId.documentation: The ID of the user being replied to.

ContributorId.documentation: The ID of the user who made the comment.

ConflictingOperationException.documentation: Another operation is in progress on the resource that conflicts with the current operation.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

ThreadId.documentation: The ID of the root comment in the thread.

Visibility.documentation: The visibility of the comment. Options are either PRIVATE, where the comment is visible only to the comment author and document owner and co-owners, or PUBLIC, where the comment is visible to document owners, co-owners, and contributors.

NotifyCollaborators.documentation: Set this parameter to TRUE to send an email out to the document collaborators after the comment is created.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

VersionId.documentation: The ID of the version, if the custom metadata is being added to a document version.

CustomMetadata.documentation: Custom metadata in the form of name-value pairs.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Labels.documentation: List of labels to add to the resource.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Endpoint.documentation: The endpoint to receive the notifications. If the protocol is HTTPS, the endpoint is a URL that begins with https.

Protocol.documentation: The protocol to use. The supported value is https, which delivers JSON-encoded messages using HTTPS POST.

TimeZoneId.documentation: The time zone ID of the user.

StorageRule.documentation: The amount of storage for the user.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

CustomMetadataLimitExceededException.documentation: The limit has been reached on the number of custom properties for the specified resource.

DateRangeType.documentation: Filters results based on timestamp range (in epochs).

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

DeactivatingLastSystemUserException.documentation: The last user in the organization is being deactivated.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.
Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

ResourceId.documentation: The ID of the resource, either a document or folder.

VersionId.documentation: The ID of the version, if the custom metadata is being deleted from a document version.

DeleteAll.documentation: Flag to indicate removal of all custom metadata properties from the specified resource.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.
Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

DocumentId.documentation: The ID of the document associated with the version being deleted.

VersionId.documentation: The ID of the version being deleted.

DeletePriorVersions.documentation: Deletes all versions of a document prior to the current version.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.
Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.
Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Labels.documentation: List of labels to delete from the resource.

DeleteAll.documentation: Flag to request removal of all labels from the specified resource.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using Amazon Web Services credentials.
Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

StartTime.documentation: The timestamp that determines the starting time of the activities. The response includes the activities performed after the specified timestamp.

EndTime.documentation: The timestamp that determines the end time of the activities. The response includes the activities performed before the specified timestamp.

OrganizationId.documentation: The ID of the organization. This is a mandatory parameter when using administrative API (SigV4) requests.

ActivityTypes.documentation: Specifies which activity types to include in the response. If this field is left empty, all activity types are returned.

ResourceId.documentation: The document or folder ID for which to describe activity types.

UserId.documentation: The ID of the user who performed the action. The response includes activities pertaining to this user. This is an optional parameter and is only applicable for administrative API (SigV4) requests.

IncludeIndirectActivities.documentation: Includes indirect activities. An indirect activity results from a direct activity performed on a parent resource. For example, sharing a parent folder (the direct activity) shares all of the subfolders and documents within the parent folder (the indirect activity).

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of items to return.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results.

UserActivities.documentation: The list of activities for the specified user and time period.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of items to return.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results. This marker was received from a previous call.

Comments.documentation: The list of comments for the specified document version.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results. This marker was received from a previous call.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of versions to return with this call.

Include.documentation: A comma-separated list of values. Specify "INITIALIZED" to include incomplete versions.

Fields.documentation: Specify "SOURCE" to include initialized versions and a URL for the source document.

Marker.documentation: The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there are no additional results, the string is empty.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Order.documentation: The order for the contents of the folder.

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results. This marker was received from a previous call.

Include.documentation: The contents to include. Specify "INITIALIZED" to include initialized documents.

Marker.documentation: The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there are no additional results, the string is empty.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

SearchQuery.documentation: A query to describe groups by group name.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

Marker.documentation: The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there are no additional results, the string is empty.
The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

Marker.documentation: The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there are no additional results, the string is empty.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

PrincipalId.documentation: The ID of the principal to filter permissions by.

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call)
The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there are no additional results, the string is empty.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token.

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of items to return.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)
The marker for the next set of results.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Query.documentation:
A query to filter users by user name. Remember the following about the Userids and Query parameters:

  • If you don't use either parameter, the API returns a paginated list of all users on the site.

  • If you use both parameters, the API ignores the Query parameter.

  • The Userid parameter only returns user names that match a corresponding user ID.

  • The Query parameter runs a "prefix" search for users by the GivenName, SurName, or UserName fields included in a CreateUser API call. For example, querying on Ma returns Márcia Oliveira, María García, and Mateo Jackson. If you use multiple characters, the API only returns data that matches all characters. For example, querying on Ma J only returns Mateo Jackson.

Include.documentation: The state of the users. Specify "ALL" to include inactive users.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of items to return.

Fields.documentation: A comma-separated list of values. Specify "STORAGE_METADATA" to include the user storage quota and utilization information.

TotalNumberOfUsers.documentation: The total number of users included in the results.

Marker.documentation: The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there are no additional results, the string is empty.

DocumentLockedForCommentsException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the document is locked for comments and user tries to create or delete a comment on that document.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time when the document was created.

ModifiedTimestamp.documentation: The time when the document was updated.

Size.documentation: The size of the document, in bytes.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp when the document was first uploaded.

ModifiedTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp when the document was last uploaded.

ContentCreatedTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp when the content of the document was originally created.

ContentModifiedTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp when the content of the document was modified.

DraftUploadOutOfSyncException.documentation: This exception is thrown when a valid checkout ID is not presented on document version upload calls for a document that has been checked out from Web client.

FailedDependencyException.documentation: The Directory Service cannot reach an on-premises instance. Or a dependency under the control of the organization is failing, such as a connected Active Directory.

TextLocales.documentation: Filters by the locale of the content or comment.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time when the folder was created.

ModifiedTimestamp.documentation: The time when the folder was updated.

Signature.documentation: The unique identifier created from the subfolders and documents of the folder.

LatestVersionSize.documentation: The size of the latest version of the folder metadata.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token.
Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of levels in the hierarchy to return.

Fields.documentation: A comma-separated list of values. Specify NAME to include the names of the parent folders.

Marker.documentation: This value is not supported.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

IncludeCustomMetadata.documentation: Set this to TRUE to include custom metadata in the response.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Fields.documentation: A comma-separated list of values. Specify "SOURCE" to include a URL for the source document.

IncludeCustomMetadata.documentation: Set this to TRUE to include custom metadata in the response.

CustomMetadata.documentation: The custom metadata on the document version.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of levels in the hierarchy to return.

Fields.documentation: A comma-separated list of values. Specify "NAME" to include the names of the parent folders.

Marker.documentation: This value is not supported.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

IncludeCustomMetadata.documentation: Set to TRUE to include custom metadata in the response.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: The Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

UserId.documentation: The user ID for the resource collection. This is a required field for accessing the API operation using IAM credentials.

Limit.documentation: The maximum number of resources to return.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results. This marker was received from a previous call.
The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there are no additional results, the string is empty.

GroupMetadata.documentation: Describes the metadata of a user group.

IllegalUserStateException.documentation: The user is undergoing transfer of ownership.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

ContentCreatedTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp when the content of the document was originally created.

ContentModifiedTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp when the content of the document was modified.

DocumentSizeInBytes.documentation: The size of the document, in bytes.

InvalidArgumentException.documentation: The pagination marker or limit fields are not valid.

InvalidCommentOperationException.documentation: The requested operation is not allowed on the specified comment object.

LimitExceededException.documentation: The maximum of 100,000 files and folders under the parent folder has been exceeded.

SendEmail.documentation: Boolean value to indicate an email notification should be sent to the recipients.

EmailMessage.documentation: Text value to be included in the email body.

NotificationOptions.documentation: Set of options which defines notification preferences of given action.

ProhibitedStateException.documentation: The specified document version is not in the INITIALIZED state.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.
Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

RequestedEntityTooLargeException.documentation: The response is too large to return. The request must include a filter to reduce the size of the response.

OriginalName.documentation: The original name of the resource before a rename operation.

VersionId.documentation: The version ID of the resource. This is an optional field and is filled for action on document version.

ParentId.documentation: The parent ID of the resource before a rename operation.

ResourcePath.documentation: Describes the path information of a resource.

WebUrl.documentation: The webUrl of the item being returned.

DocumentVersionMetadata.documentation: The document version that matches the metadata.

ResponseItem.documentation: List of Documents, Folders, Comments, and Document Versions matching the query.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

Roles.documentation: The Role of a User or Group.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

QueryText.documentation: The String to search for. Searches across different text fields based on request parameters. Use double quotes around the query string for exact phrase matches.

QueryScopes.documentation: Filter based on the text field type. A Folder has only a name and no content. A Comment has only content and no name. A Document or Document Version has a name and content

OrganizationId.documentation: Filters based on the resource owner OrgId. This is a mandatory parameter when using Admin SigV4 credentials.

AdditionalResponseFields.documentation: A list of attributes to include in the response. Used to request fields that are not normally returned in a standard response.

OrderBy.documentation: Order by results in one or more categories.

Marker.documentation: The marker for the next set of results.

Items.documentation: List of Documents, Folders, Comments, and Document Versions matching the query.

Marker.documentation: The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there are no additional results, the string is empty.

Field.documentation: Sort search results based on this field name.

ServiceUnavailableException.documentation: One or more of the dependencies is unavailable.

SharePrincipal.documentation: Describes the recipient type and ID, if available.

ShareId.documentation: The ID of the resource that was shared.

ShareResult.documentation: Describes the share results of a resource.

StorageAllocatedInBytes.documentation: The amount of storage allocated, in bytes.

TooManyLabelsException.documentation: The limit has been reached on the number of labels for the specified resource.

TooManySubscriptionsException.documentation: You've reached the limit on the number of subscriptions for the WorkDocs instance.

UnauthorizedResourceAccessException.documentation: The caller does not have access to perform the action on the resource.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

ResourceState.documentation: The resource state of the document. Only ACTIVE and RECYCLED are supported.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.
Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

ResourceState.documentation: The resource state of the folder. Only ACTIVE and RECYCLED are accepted values from the API.

AuthenticationToken.documentation: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Not required when using Amazon Web Services administrator credentials to access the API.

StorageRule.documentation: The amount of storage for the user.

TimeZoneId.documentation: The time zone ID of the user.

GrantPoweruserPrivileges.documentation: Boolean value to determine whether the user is granted Power user privileges.

RecycleBinFolderId.documentation: The ID of the recycle bin folder.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time when the user was created.

ModifiedTimestamp.documentation: The time when the user was modified.

TimeZoneId.documentation: The time zone ID of the user.

GivenName.documentation: The given name of the user before a rename operation.

StorageUtilizedInBytes.documentation: The amount of storage used, in bytes.

documentation:
The Amazon WorkDocs API is designed for the following use cases:

  • File Migration: File migration applications are supported for users who want to migrate their files from an on-premises or off-premises file system or service. Users can insert files into a user directory structure, as well as allow for basic metadata changes, such as modifications to the permissions of files.

  • Security: Support security applications are supported for users who have additional security needs, such as antivirus or data loss prevention. The API actions, along with CloudTrail, allow these applications to detect when changes occur in Amazon WorkDocs. Then, the application can take the necessary actions and replace the target file. If the target file violates the policy, the application can also choose to email the user.

  • eDiscovery/Analytics: General administrative applications are supported, such as eDiscovery and analytics. These applications can choose to mimic or record the actions in an Amazon WorkDocs site, along with CloudTrail, to replicate data for eDiscovery, backup, or analytical applications.

All Amazon WorkDocs API actions are Amazon authenticated and certificate-signed. They not only require the use of the Amazon Web Services SDK, but also allow for the exclusive use of IAM users and roles to help facilitate access, trust, and permission policies. By creating a role and allowing an IAM user to access the Amazon WorkDocs site, the IAM user gains full administrative visibility into the entire Amazon WorkDocs site (or as set in the IAM policy). This includes, but is not limited to, the ability to modify file permissions and upload any file to any user. This allows developers to perform the three use cases above, as well as give users the ability to grant access on a selective basis using the IAM model.

The pricing for Amazon WorkDocs APIs varies depending on the API call type for these actions:

  • READ (Get*)

  • WRITE (Activate*, Add*, Create*, Deactivate*, Initiate*, Update*)

  • LIST (Describe*)

  • DELETE*, CANCEL

For information about Amazon WorkDocs API pricing, see Amazon WorkDocs Pricing.
